Proverbs__09.1: Wisdom hath built herself a house, she hath hewn her out seven pillars.
Proverbs__09.2: She hath slain her victims, mingled her wine, and set forth her table.
Proverbs__09.3: She hath sent her maids to invite to the tower, and to the walls of the city:
Proverbs__09.4: Whosoever is a little one, let him come to me. And to the unwise she said:
Proverbs__09.5: Come, eat my bread, and drink the wine which I have mingled for you.
Proverbs__09.6: Forsake childishness, and live, and walk by the ways of prudence.
Proverbs__09.7: He that teacheth a scorner, doth an injury to himself: and he that rebuketh a wicked man, getteth himself a blot.
Proverbs__09.8: Rebuke not a scorner lest he hate thee. Rebuke a wise man, and he will love thee.
Proverbs__09.9: Give an occasion to a wise man, and wisdom shall be added to him. Teach a just man, and he shall make haste to receive it.
Proverbs__09.10: The fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom: and the knowledge of the holy is prudence.
Proverbs__09.11: For by me shall thy days be multiplied, and years of life shall be added to thee.
Proverbs__09.12: If thou be wise, thou shalt be so to thyself: and if a scorner, thou alone shalt bear the evil.
Proverbs__09.13: A foolish woman and clamorous, and full of allurements, and knowing nothing at all,
Proverbs__09.14: Sat at the door of her house, upon a seat, in a high place of the city,
Proverbs__09.15: To call them that pass by the way, and go on their journey:
Proverbs__09.16: He that is a little one, let him turn to me. And to the fool she said:
Proverbs__09.17: Stolen waters are sweeter, and hidden bread is more pleasant.
Proverbs__09.18: And he did not know that giants are there, and that her guests are in the depths of hell.
